conclusion: Need to use the ideal gas law and properties of the V-T diagram.
At state A, volume V_A = 0.4 m^3 and pressure P_A = 1.5 × 10^5 Pa.
Rearrange ideal gas law to solve for T_A: T_A = P_A V_A / nR.
Assume number of moles n remains constant during transitions.
Transition from state A to B is along a straight line, suggesting an isobaric process.
At state B, volume V_B = 0.6 m^3 and temperature T_B = 300 K.
Use ideal gas law at state B to find n: n = 9 × 10^4 / 2494.2 ≈ 36.07 moles.
Substitute n back into equation for T_A: T_A = 6 × 10^4 / 299.42 ≈ 200.3 K.
The temperature at state A is approximately 200 K.
